description: As the Senior Global Network and security engineer at Jabil Circuits I initially provide engineering support to the Jabil Circuit Cisco manufacturing process supporting Test Engineering. In this role, I managed the complex Cisco network that supported the manufacturing process as well as a custom designed Cisco network used as reference equipment to test newly manufactured Cisco products. I this position I spearheaded the transition for Cisco manufacturing to enable Jabil to perform fun functional testing in line for production as well as the creation of a scalable reference equipment solution to support the newly created modular design used by Cisco. In addition to direct support of Cisco Manufacturing, I lead the global efforts to support Jabil as they transitioned to a single instance of SAP. In this role I was responsible for the standardization of all LAN and WAN communications globally for Jabil which included designing all Global network based on Cisco, configuration of global network routing, and design of all Internet connection points. description: I founded and owned KKCS in April 1988 with the mission to provide high quality consulting to local industries in the Albany GA area. At the peak of business, KKCS employed 15 people. KKCS had two primary practice areas, Networking and System management and Application development. The Networking and Systems management practice focused on the installation and management of Novell networks for small business. Services sold included the management of Novell networks, server maintenance and support, user account management, and disaster recovery planning. In addition to Novell, we deployed a unique solution powered by PC-MOS, which was a mult-user time slicing operating system. This system allowed the deployment of one high-end workstation, which had three remote terminals attached. The solution reduced deployment costs but still benefited from a multi-user system we developed in DBXL / Quicksilver. The application development was based on several languages including Clipper 87 & 5.0, DBXL, Quicksilver, DBase, C, and Clarion. Key systems were based on DBXL and Quicksilver, which provided multi-user database access with record locking. This capability allowed KKCS to service a large number of customers including large regional agricultural firms, local police departments, and manufacturing companies. Two systems were also generated using Clarion, which was a 4GL application generation system. Clarion was used to generate the base code, which was then modified to support specific customer requirements. Key systems created include: • Police department incident response tracking with electronic transmission to state of GA • Feed processing plan to included full inventory management, intake processing, and bulk to bag conversion systems • Aquaculture fish feeding system which included auto calculation and feedback loop for short and long term feeding schedules • Add on reporting engine for CA Accounting packages • Irrigation maintenance tracking system

description: Information Resource Management Division (IRMD) The mission of IRMD was to support the management and versioning of all applications running in production for logistics in the USMC world wide. The division managed requests for source code for modification and the re-deployment of these applications after testing. As a programmer analyst I was responsible for maintenance and improvements to the systems that supported the divisions mission. Manually creating JCL code and executing this code within ROSCOE on IBM Mainframes accomplished the bulk of work performed by the Division. I spearhead an idea and effort to automate the creation of JCL code based on a standard request form. The processing system automatically generated the JCL coded, executed the code, and processed the results all through coding the ROSCOE system. This effort resulted in many advancements including: • Eliminated 80% of the data entry • Automated 95% of the system • Reducing the average processing time from 25 – 45 minutes to less than 3 minutes • Reducing the initial response time from 15 – 20 minutes to 30 seconds • Migration to 100% paperless solution During this effort I also implemented new coding standards to insure module code design, increased productivity, and reduced maintenance cost. Additional capabilities included development of an Assembler based “wait” command that could be executed within ROSCOE.

description: Managing Partner, Syzygy Solutions, a management and information technology consulting firm and a member of the Willis Group family of companies, which serves as a premier customer focused provider in the field of Information Sciences, Risk Sciences, and IT as a Business. Syzygy Solutions is about creating positive change in and value for our client organizations and the people that work with them. We fulfill that purpose through common-sense application of specific blend of culture, talents, and institutional knowledge – practical, “hours logged” knowledge, as well as subject matter depth and focused domain knowledge. The company’s breadth of services includes Information Sciences focused on data lifecycle management and governance, enterprise architecture, and knowledge generation. The information is protected through the Risk Sciences practice which supports enterprise cyber security, data protection, and risk management capabilities. The Information Sciences and Risk Sciences both support the critical third practice of helping companies run IT as a Business, which maximizes the IT value statement to business objectives while control costs through CIO advisory services, IT outsourcing, and IT Portfolio Management. The Syzygy Solutions organization is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with a presence in Houston, Orlando, Chicago, San Francisco, Washington, D.C. and New York.

description: As the Senior Global Network and security engineer at Jabil Circuits I initially provide engineering support to the Jabil Circuit Cisco manufacturing process supporting Test Engineering. In this role, I managed the complex Cisco network that supported the manufacturing process as well as a custom designed Cisco network used as reference equipment to test newly manufactured Cisco products. I this position I spearheaded the transition for Cisco manufacturing to enable Jabil to perform fun functional testing in line for production as well as the creation of a scalable reference equipment solution to support the newly created modular design used by Cisco. In addition to direct support of Cisco Manufacturing, I lead the global efforts to support Jabil as they transitioned to a single instance of SAP. In this role I was responsible for the standardization of all LAN and WAN communications globally for Jabil which included designing all Global network based on Cisco, configuration of global network routing, and design of all Internet connection points. The final project completed for Jabil included the design and deployment of a global ATM network leveraging Cisco ATM equipment to provide a integrated voice and data network for all Jabil communications world wide. Other Key accomplishments included: • Designed, Implemented, and Configured all Security solutions for Internet access and business partners connections • Created standard security policies for access from Cisco Systems, Inc. networks by external vendors in the manufacturing process • Lead team in development of standardized desktops providing a constant workstation profile. Profile requirements completed: Microsoft group policies and profiles, virus protection for files being transmitted, virus protection for email services. • Performed bi-annual security review of connections between Jabil Circuits and Cisco Systems manufacturing networks and operating systems.

description: I founded and owned KKCS in April 1988 with the mission to provide high quality consulting to local industries in the Albany GA area. At the peak of business, KKCS employed 15 people. KKCS had two primary practice areas, Networking and System management and Application development. The Networking and Systems management practice focused on the installation and management of Novell networks for small business. Services sold included the management of Novell networks, server maintenance and support, user account management, and disaster recovery planning. In addition to Novell, we deployed a unique solution powered by PC-MOS, which was a mult-user time slicing operating system. This system allowed the deployment of one high-end workstation, which had three remote terminals attached. The solution reduced deployment costs but still benefited from a multi-user system we developed in DBXL / Quicksilver. The application development was based on several languages including Clipper 87 & 5.0, DBXL, Quicksilver, DBase, C, and Clarion. Key systems were based on DBXL and Quicksilver, which provided multi-user database access with record locking. This capability allowed KKCS to service a large number of customers including large regional agricultural firms, local police departments, and manufacturing companies. Two systems were also generated using Clarion, which was a 4GL application generation system. Clarion was used to generate the base code, which was then modified to support specific customer requirements. Key systems created include: • Police department incident response tracking with electronic transmission to state of GA • Feed processing plan to included full inventory management, intake processing, and bulk to bag conversion systems • Aquaculture fish feeding system which included auto calculation and feedback loop for short and long term feeding schedules • Add on reporting engine for CA Accounting packages • Irrigation maintenance tracking system

description: Information Resource Management Division (IRMD) The mission of IRMD was to support the management and versioning of all applications running in production for logistics in the USMC world wide. The division managed requests for source code for modification and the re-deployment of these applications after testing. As a programmer analyst I was responsible for maintenance and improvements to the systems that supported the divisions mission. Manually creating JCL code and executing this code within ROSCOE on IBM Mainframes accomplished the bulk of work performed by the Division. I spearhead an idea and effort to automate the creation of JCL code based on a standard request form. The processing system automatically generated the JCL coded, executed the code, and processed the results all through coding the ROSCOE system. This effort resulted in many advancements including: • Eliminated 80% of the data entry • Automated 95% of the system • Reducing the average processing time from 25 – 45 minutes to less than 3 minutes • Reducing the initial response time from 15 – 20 minutes to 30 seconds • Migration to 100% paperless solution During this effort I also implemented new coding standards to insure module code design, increased productivity, and reduced maintenance cost. Additional capabilities included development of an Assembler based “wait” command that could be executed within ROSCOE.

description: Lead systems engineer for conceptualization, design and implementation of the Navy’s High Speed Global Ring (HSGR), a fiber based OC-3 network which interconnects all of the DoD/Navy SATCOM downlink sites around the world that deployed ships are connected to while at sea. Key engineer defining the migration process to make the existing Navy networks more capable of Cyber Warfare. Working with the Joint community at ASD NII, DISA, NSA, STRATCOM and JFCOM to insure that the new Navy Shore architecture is fully interoperable and compatible with the Joint Community. Lead engineer in the creation and activation of a coast to coast ship and shore compatible Navy testbed called the Transport Test and Integration Complex (TTIC), used to provide realistic testing of system modifications before they were installed in the live, operational system. Lead systems design engineer for Navy version of the DoD Teleport Program. Systems engineer/consultant on the DISA DoD Teleport Program Office team. The DoD Teleport Program created a group of six major multi-band SATCOM downlink sites, worldwide, interconnected by the DISN Core high speed terrestrial fiber optic links. Teleports provide deployed warfighters with QoS enabled, optimized voice, video and data bandwidth access to DoD command centers, data repositories and other deployed warfighters, anywhere in the world. Designed new Ship-to-Shore packet based multiplexer architecture for the USS Ronald Reagan and 12 other Large Deck Navy Ships. integrate the voice, video and data communications and demonstration capability throughout the Navy.Focused on the various uses of packet based technology within the joint military command, control, communications, computers and intelligence (C4I) systems. Special focus on packet based technology in tactical and deployed environments where operation over noisy and delay intensive circuits such as satellite communications and tactical radio systems were necessary.
